skill.name: writing-to-logseq
skill.description: Expert in writing data to Logseq DB graphs via HTTP API. Auto-invokes when users want to create pages, add blocks, update content, set properties, or sync conversation notes to their Logseq graph. Provides CRUD operations with safety guidelines.
skill.summary: Expert in writing data to Logseq DB graphs via HTTP API. Auto-invokes when users want to create page...
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate Logseq integration skill that provides safe CRUD operations via local HTTP API. The code only connects to localhost (127.0.0.1:12315) where Logseq runs. No external network access, no credential theft patterns, no code execution risks beyond its stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Manually copying information to Logseq takes time. This skill provides programmatic access to create pages, add blocks, set properties, and sync conversation notes directly to your Logsec graph via the HTTP API.
actual_capabilities: Create pages with initial content and properties
Add blocks as children or siblings of existing content
Update and delete blocks and pages
Set typed properties (text, number, date, checkbox)
Add and remove tags from blocks
limitations: Requires Logsum HTTP API to be enabled with API token
Only connects to local Logsum instance (localhost)
Cannot query or read data (use separate reading skill)
Rate limited by Logsum API responsiveness

use_cases.title: Capture AI conversation insights
use_cases.description: Automatically sync Claude Code conversations to your Logsum knowledge base with timestamps for later reference.

use_cases.title: Create structured project pages
use_cases.description: Generate project pages with tasks, properties, and nested blocks following consistent templates.

use_cases.title: Build interconnected knowledge graphs
use_cases.description: Create linked pages, add tags, and build relationships between research notes and sources.

prompt_templates.title: Create simple page
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Logsum page called '{{Page Title}}' with this content: {{content}}

prompt_templates.title: Add task with properties
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a task block to my '{{Project}}' page with content '{{task description}}', priority '{{priority}}', and due date {{date}}

prompt_templates.title: Sync conversation
prompt_templates.prompt: Sync these conversation notes to Logsum under 'Claude Notes/{{topic}}': {{notes}}

prompt_templates.title: Build knowledge structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a structured Logsum page for '{{subject}}' in the '{{category}}' namespace with overview, key points, and action items sections

output_examples.input:
Create a page called 'Meeting Notes 2024-01-15' with content '## Attendees
- John
- Jane

## Action Items
- [ ] Review proposal'
output: Created page 'Meeting Notes 2024-01-15' with UUID abc-123-def-456
Added first block with initial content
Ready to add more blocks or properties

best_practices: Use get_or_create_page() instead of create_page() to avoid duplicate errors
Verify resources exist before deleting with confirm-before-delete checks
Add rate limiting (0.1s delay) between batch operations to avoid overwhelming the API
anti_patterns: Don't use create_page() multiple times with the same title (causes DuplicateError)
Avoid bulk delete operations without size limits (prevents accidental data loss)
Do not modify system properties like uuid, created-at, or block/parent directly

faq.question: Is Logsum API required?
faq.answer: Yes, Logsum must have HTTP API enabled in settings with an API token configured.

faq.question: Can this read Logsum data?
faq.answer: No, this skill only handles write operations. Use the 'reading-logsum' skill for data retrieval.

faq.question: What data types are supported?
faq.answer: Strings, numbers, dates (linked format), checkboxes, and tags are fully supported.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, all operations target your local Logsum instance only. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why do I get DuplicateError?
faq.answer: The page already exists. Use get_or_create_page() for idempotent operations.

faq.question: How is this different from other skills?
faq.answer: This provides direct HTTP API access for programmatic control. Other methods may use file-based syncing.
